What is the kinetic isotope effect?
o: Different reaction rates for isotopically substituted species

q: The kinetic isotope effect is larger for _____ mass differences.

Arrange isotope effects:
Kinetic isotope effects contribute to isotopic fractionation.

o: Exchange of material and energy between gas and dust

o: The challenge of accounting for all oxygen in dense clouds

q: Much oxygen may be locked in _____ form not easily observable.

o: Whether all important reactions are included in chemical models
